Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: The first recording file is a rough-cut interview with publisher Leon Shimkin. He discusses the landscape and ethics of publishing and its history in the United States.|~|The second recording file is a continuation of an interview with publisher Leon Shimkin.|~|L. Shimkin - Box 7 #95
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Unaired Interview with Publisher Leon Shimkin

Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: Gene Smith - Box 13 #195|~|The recording begins with what seems to be notes from Roy Newquist about having talked to Frank Sinatra. The remainder appears to be the Gene Smith Counterpoint broadcast.|~|The second recording (side 2) contains a copy of the latter part of the first recording (without the Frank Sinatra notes). In the interview with Gene Smith, he talks about his biography with President Wilson, and his methods for writing the book. Smith also provides some anecdotes about President Wilson.
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Counterpoint: Gene Smith

Project Name: Sales (Ephraim) Collection of Interviews by Roy Newquist
Name.repository: University of California, Los Angeles. Library. Department of Special Collections
Description.note: Both recordings contain parts one and two of a rough cut interview with actress Myrna Loy. Topics mainly focus on her acting career and philanthropic work.|~|Myrna Loy - Box 9 #122
Format.extent: 1 sound tape reel (54:05) : analog ; 5 in., 1/4 in. tape
Title: Unaired Interview with Actress Myrna Loy
